title: Cards from the Cambridge Collection Available-HOF images Posted
author: oldjudge

posts.post_title: Cards from the Cambridge Collection Available-HOF images Posted
posts.post_content:
Many cards from the remarkable Cambridge Scrapbook Collection are available for sale and trade. This includes Old Judges, including many HOFers,  and a tremendous amount of pre-1900 non-sports. If you have specific interests please email me at [url]oldjudge@gmail.com[/url]

Thanks--Jay
Congrats!!  You got a great deal on that huge lot!  I expected it to go for double what you paid!  Some incredible cards in that lot...
Can someone post a link?

Awesome grab Jay. Congrats.

[url]http://goldinauctions.com/the-cambridge-collection---a-significant-19th-cent-lot5328.aspx[/url]
Fantastic cards, but strangely almost completely devoid of Detroit OJs.  Best of luck with them Jay.
PM

Two requests:

1. Please respond to my email address--do not send messages through the chat board. It is easy for me to reply back with images that way. My email address, as indicated above, is [url]oldjudge@gmail.com[/url]

2. I do not have a list of all the Old Judge cards available. Besides, in addition to the Cambridge Collection I have a large number of other Old Judge duplicates.  If you have specific cards you are looking for I may be of help. If you are looking for a representative Old Judge card I am not your guy. You would do better just finding a card you like on ebay. That is the best advice I can give

Thanks for looking!

Jay - Sent you an email a few days ago with list of names. Let me know if you didn't get it and I will resend.

Thanks - Happy Holidays - J
Jay, I got the two cards you sent me.  Simply stunning images.

Some of the scarcer cards are already gone. However, there are some amazing copies of a few HOFers. The lot has one of the nicest Griffith images I have ever seen, in a card that very often comes with a pinkish faded photo ($2500). There are also some really sharp Ewings, including an amazing bat at side pose. Also included are two very nice O'Rourkes, a beautiful Connor, and a nice O'Day. Also available are a Mack, some Wards, and a Keefe Gypsy Queen (not the Cambridge Collection one). The Kellys, the Rusie, the Wright, and the McPhee are already gone. If interested, I will send iPhone images if you email me at [url]oldjudge@gmail.com[/url]

Thanks--Jay
The Griffith with the fantastic image is gone. However, there are still many HOFers with really sharp images. This lot had cards with way above average contrast.
Script Connor is now gone. The Welch still left has an incredible image but it is not cheap ($3500)
Some images. Gone--thanks John
O'Rourke--$1850 each
Three Ewings--prices from $1650-$1850. Ewing bat at side is gone.
Keefe Gypsy Queen--$5500
O'Days--$1350 and $750
Amazing image, period trim(it's been in a scrapbook for about 125 years)--$750
Jay, I'll take Welch. Thanks Jay.

There are still many cards with beautiful images left. Please contact me with interests (oldjudge@gmail.com)

Thanks--Jay
Scarcer pose of a relatively scarce HOFer, Roger Connor--$1450
An affordable copy of new HOFer Hank O'Day--$650

Jay,

please take some of the proceeds and buy a $50 Epson scanner, it's the 21st century:D
Scott--LOL, I've just progressed from drawing a picture of the card.
Bump - Thank you for the cards Jay.
